Family comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jeff Garlin, Steve Zahn and Anjelica Huston

programme.title: Baby's Day Out
programme.desc: Three bungling kidnappers hatch a plan to pose as society reporters and snatch the baby son of a wealthy couple. However, the infant escapes on to the streets of New York, evading the crooks' every attempt to recapture him. Comedy, starring Joe Mantegna, Lara Flynn Boyle, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley

programme.title: Problem Child
programme.desc: When a couple seek to adopt a child from an orphanage, the administrator sees the chance to rid himself of the bane of his existence - an uncontrollable youngster who causes chaos and destruction wherever he goes. Comedy, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Jack Warden, Peter Jurasik and Michael Oliver(n)

programme.title: Problem Child II
programme.desc: Single father Ben Healy with his obnoxious adopted son in tow moves to a new town in search of romance, but ends up with yet another wayward youngster on his hands. Comedy sequel, starring John Ritter, Amy Yasbeck, Charlene Tilton, and Laraine Newman(n)

programme.title: Baby's Day Out
programme.desc: Three bungling kidnappers hatch a plan to pose as society reporters and snatch the baby son of a wealthy couple. However, the infant escapes on to the streets of New York, evading the crooks' every attempt to recapture him. Comedy, starring Joe Mantegna, Lara Flynn Boyle, Joe Pantoliano and Brian Haley(n)

programme.title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
programme.desc: A feisty foster kid comes up with an outlandish scheme to be reunited with her birth mum. Coming-of-age drama, starring Kathy Bates, Glenn Close and Sophie Nelisse(n)

programme.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
programme.desc: A fairy living in a forest encounters a member of a lumber crew and magically shrinks him down to her size. He learns about the damage humans are doing to the area, and helps defend it when his fellow loggers unwittingly unleash an evil spirit that had been entombed in a tree. Animated adventure, with the voices of Robin Williams, Christian Slater and Tim Curry(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: A nomadic tribe on Inuits lies on the brink of starvation. Three young members of the community are sent on a quest to find a mythical promised land where they can make their new home, but the tribe's shaman sees this hope as a threat to his power, and plots to ensure they do not return. Animated adventure, with the voices of Rachelle Lefevre, Christopher Plummer and Genevieve Bujold(n)

programme.title: The Water Horse: Legend of the Deep
programme.desc: A lonely boy living in the Scottish Highlands during the Second World War stumbles on a curiously large egg by the water's edge of the local loch. Astonishingly, it hatches into a cute baby sea monster and, although he tries his hardest to keep it concealed, the task is made almost impossible by the creature's alarming rate of growth. Children's fantasy adventure, based on the book by Dick King-Smith, with Alex Etel, Emily Watson and David Morrissey(n)

programme.title: Minions
programme.desc: A race of strange, babbling yellow creatures has served the cause of evil throughout the history of the world. In the 1960s, three of these eternal henchmen get a job working for a criminal genius who is hatching a plot against the British crown - but while carrying out her orders, they uncover a threat to their whole species. Animated comedy, with the voices of Sandra Bullock, Pierre Coffin, Jon Hamm and Michael Keaton(n)

programme.title: Survive the Serengeti: Against the Wild 2
programme.desc: When their plane crash-lands in the African bush, two bickering siblings find themselves force to rely on their wits - and their courageous dog - to help them conquer their fears and survive. Adventure, starring Jeri Ryan, John Paul Ruttan and Ella Ballentine(n)

programme.title: An Eskimo Tale
programme.desc: A nomadic tribe on Inuits lies on the brink of starvation. Three young members of the community are sent on a quest to find a mythical promised land where they can make their new home, but the tribe's shaman sees this hope as a threat to his power, and plots to ensure they do not return. programme.title: The Great Gilly Hopkins
programme.desc: A feisty foster kid comes up with an outlandish scheme to be reunited with her birth mum. Coming-of-age drama, starring Kathy Bates, Glenn Close and Sophie Nelisse(n)

programme.title: Survive the Serengeti: Against the Wild 2
programme.desc: When their plane crash-lands in the African bush, two bickering siblings find themselves force to rely on their wits - and their courageous dog - to help them conquer their fears and survive. Adventure, starring Jeri Ryan, John Paul Ruttan and Ella Ballentine(n)

programme.title: Fast & Furious
programme.desc: News of a friend's murder brings international fugitive Dominic Toretto back to his home city of Los Angeles in search of revenge. It is not long before his pursuit leads him to cross paths with FBI agent Brian O'Conner, and despite their hostile feelings toward each other, the pair work together to bring down those responsible. Thriller sequel, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster

programme.title: Terminal Velocity
programme.desc: A skydiving instructor tries to clear himself of responsibility for the death of a woman whose parachute failed to open. However, he later learns she is a Russian spy who faked her own demise, and now needs his help to foil an international criminal conspiracy out to steal a fortune in bullion. Action thriller, starring Charlie Sheen, Nastassja Kinski and James Gandolfini

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos

programme.title: The Godfather: Part II
programme.desc: Mafia don Michael Corleone sets out to clinch a make-or-break deal with an ageing gangster - but his plans are blown apart by a traitor within the family. Michael's story is intercut with flashback sequences chronicling the early life of his father Vito, as he makes the shift from immigrant grocery-store clerk to Mob kingpin. Francis Ford Coppola's Oscar-winning crime drama sequel, with Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Robert Duvall, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, John Cazale, Michael V Gazzo and Lee Strasberg

programme.title: Careful What You Wish For
programme.desc: A teenager gets more than he bargained for after entering into an affair with the wife of an investment banker, as a suspicious death and substantial life insurance policy embroil him in a scandal. Thriller, starring Nick Jonas, Dermot Mulroney and Isabel Lucas

programme.title: US Marshals
programme.desc: A federal marshal sets out in pursuit of an escaped prisoner who is determined to prove his murder conviction was false. As the chase progresses, the marshal is forced to work with a diplomatic security agent, making him realise the fugitive is no ordinary convict and that his claims of innocence may be true. Thriller sequel, starring Tommy Lee Jones reprising his Oscar-winning role from The Fugitive, alongside Wesley Snipes and Robert Downey Jr

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Domino
programme.desc: The daughter of a respected actor becomes bored with her high society lifestyle and trains to become a bounty hunter. However, the thrills of her new occupation, coupled with the presence of television cameras recording her exploits for a reality TV show, soon send her life spiralling out of control. Thriller, starring Keira Knightley, Mickey Rourke and Jacqueline Bisset

programme.title: In the Line of Fire
programme.desc: An ageing secret service agent, tormented by his failure to save the life of John F Kennedy in 1963, is drawn into a battle of wits with a sinister CIA-trained assassin out to kill the current president. As the day of reckoning draws closer, the agent's nerves are tested to the limit - and nothing seems to be going his way. Wolfgang Petersen's thriller, starring Clint Eastwood, John Malkovich, Rene Russo and Dylan McDermott

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a white supremacist movement to prevent their planned terrorist attack. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Radcliffe and Toni Collette

programme.title: Spectre
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux and Ralph Fiennes

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: A former gangster is released from jail and vows to go straight, hoping to earn enough money to escape his New York roots - but his misguided loyalty to a crooked lawyer threatens to drag him back into a life of crime. Brian De Palma's thriller, starring Al Pacino, Sean Penn, Penelope Ann Miller, John Leguizamo and Viggo Mortensen

programme.title: Zulu
programme.desc: Two South African police officers, one black and one white, investigate the murder of a teenage girl. The case brings to light the lingering consequences of apartheid, and forces both men to face up to their own roles in their country's brutal history. Crime drama based on Caryl Ferey's novel, with Forest Whitaker and Orlando Bloom

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster

programme.title: The Godfather: Part III
programme.desc: Twenty years after ordering the murder of his brother, ageing don Michael Corleone is close to fulfilling his dream of severing his family's Mafia ties and gaining legitimacy, but vengeful enemies and the actions of his hot-headed nephew soon draw him back into a life of crime. Conclusion of Francis Ford Coppola's crime drama trilogy, starring Al Pacino, Andy Garcia, Diane Keaton, Talia Shire, Eli Wallach, Bridget Fonda and Joe Mantegna

programme.title: The Smuggler
programme.desc: The police intercept a suspected drugs mule they believe has swallowed condoms filled with heroin on his re-entry to his native Australia. He can only be charged after the illicit substance is ejected by his body - so he spends the next week incarcerated with the authorities keeping an eye on his every movement. Comedy drama, starring Hugo Weaving, Angus Sampson and Leigh Whannell

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: A renegade general and his crack team of mercenaries take over the abandoned fortress prison of Alcatraz and threaten San Francisco with toxic nerve-gas rockets to extort a massive ransom. To break their stranglehold on the city, the FBI sends in a chemical weapons expert and a jailed SAS veteran, chosen because he is the only man to have ever escaped from the infamous penitentiary. Action thriller, with Sean Connery, Nicolas Cage and Ed Harris

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: In a move to identify suspected hijackers, an undercover police officer infiltrates the high-octane world of illegal late-night street racing by rival gangs. He is befriended by a champion driver, but when he also forms a bond with the racer's sister, he is pitched into a conflict of loyalties. Thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster

programme.title: Exposed
programme.desc: A detective is determined to bring his dead partner's killers to justice, despite warnings from both his superior officers and the murdered man's wife to forget about it. As he delves deeper, he uncovers dangerous secrets and evidence of political corruption, with a devoutly religious woman seemingly the key to the mystery. Crime thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Ana de Armas and Mira Sorvino

programme.title: Anti-Social
programme.desc: Crime drama, following the criminal exploits of anarchic street artist Dee and his violent gang member and jewel thief brother Marcus, who live on a London council estate. Starring Gregg Sulkin and Josh Myers

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts

programme.title: The Smuggler
programme.desc: The police intercept a suspected drugs mule they believe has swallowed condoms filled with heroin on his re-entry to his native Australia. He can only be charged after the illicit substance is ejected by his body - so he spends the next week incarcerated with the authorities keeping an eye on his every movement. Comedy drama, starring Hugo Weaving, Angus Sampson and Leigh Whannell

programme.title: The Fast and the Furious
programme.desc: In a move to identify suspected hijackers, an undercover police officer infiltrates the high-octane world of illegal late-night street racing by rival gangs. He is befriended by a champion driver, but when he also forms a bond with the racer's sister, he is pitched into a conflict of loyalties. Thriller, starring Vin Diesel, Paul Walker, Michelle Rodriguez and Jordana Brewster(n)

programme.title: Mississippi Burning
programme.desc: Two mismatched FBI agents, one a tough former sheriff, the other a by-the-book idealist, are sent to a small town in the Deep South to investigate the disappearance of three civil rights activists, only to come up against a conspiracy of silence. Alan Parker's drama set in the 1960s, starring Gene Hackman, Willem Dafoe, Brad Dourif, Michael Rooker, R Lee Ermey and Frances McDormand(n)

programme.title: Loss of Faith
programme.desc: A crime writer is drawn into intrigue and danger while investigating the kidnapping of a baby boy and the murder of the child's wealthy father. Mystery thriller, starring John Ritter, Michele Scarabelli, Daphne Zuniga and Roddy McDowall(n)

programme.title: Camino
programme.desc: A photographer ventures deep into the jungles of Colombia to document a group of missionaries. However, when she witnesses the leader of the group committing a horrific crime, she faces a battle for survival to make it back to civilisation with the evidence before his followers have her killed. Action thriller, starring Zoe Bell and Nacho Vigalondo(n)

programme.title: Pride and Glory
programme.desc: A family of police officers is thrown into turmoil when semi-retired brother Ray is charged with investigating the deaths of four officers during an ambush at a drug dealer's apartment. When his findings reveal evidence of departmental corruption, Ray finds himself divided between personal loyalties and duty to his badge. Thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Edward Norton, Jon Voight and Noah Emmerich(n)

programme.title: McCanick
programme.desc: A narcotics cop learns a small-time crook has been released from prison and goes behind the chief of police's back to organise a disproportionate manhunt for him. As his methods grow increasingly brutal, he comes closer to learning a secret from his own past. Detective drama, starring David Morse and Cory Monteith, in his final film role(n)

programme.title: Executive Decision
programme.desc: Terrorists armed with the world's most lethal nerve gas take over an airliner and demand a massive ransom - and only a crack team of intelligence experts can stop them before they carry out their threat to destroy Washington, DC. Action thriller, starring Kurt Russell, Steven Seagal, Halle Berry, Oliver Platt, David Suchet and John Leguizamo(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman(n)

programme.title: 2 Fast 2 Furious
programme.desc: A disgraced former cop is arrested by the FBI for illegal street racing, but his one-time colleagues offer him freedom in exchange for going on an undercover mission. Teaming up with an old racing friend and a customs official, he has to infiltrate and bring down a drug-trafficking operation. Thriller sequel, with Paul Walker reprising his role from The Fast and the Furious alongside Tyrese Gibson, Eva Mendes and Cole Hauser(n)

programme.title: Locked In
programme.desc: Sandra, a former pop star who put her career on hold to have a baby, suspects her producer-husband is now having an affair with a younger rising starlet. Determined to catch him out, she decides to surprise him by driving to Los Angeles with her young son in her new Monolith, a `super-car' with advanced security features. However, a series of unfortunate events leaves Sandra locked out of the car in the middle of the desert, while her son is trapped inside, and in mortal peril. Thriller, starring Katrina Bowden(n)

programme.title: Solace
programme.desc: A psychic is recruited by the FBI to help them track down an elusive serial killer before he can strike again. The case takes a psychologically dangerous turn when he realises that the murderer he is searching for has mental powers of his own. Crime thriller, starring Anthony Hopkins, Colin Farrell and Jeffrey Dean Morgan(n)

programme.title: Secret in Their Eyes
programme.desc: A tight-knit FBI team is torn apart when the daughter of one of the agents is raped and murdered, and the case goes unsolved. Years later, a member of the team uncovers a new clue that he hopes will allow him to bring the killer to justice. However, the victim's grieving mother is dissatisfied with the law and takes matters into her own hands. Crime drama, starring Julia Roberts, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Nicole Kidman(n)

programme.title: The Colony
programme.desc: A man travelling through Chile in the 1970s is abducted by the secret police during the military coup that brought Pinochet to power. His girlfriend tries to find out what has happened to him, but to uncover the truth, she must join a cult posing as a charitable organisation, from which no one has ever escaped. Drama, starring Emma Watson and Daniel Bruhl(n)

programme.title: Goat
programme.desc: New college student Brad is desperate to fit into his new surroundings, so taking a cue from his older brother, he decides to pledge a fraternity. All goes well at first as he attends parties and meets several girls, but as he enters into the final stretch of the pledging ritual-known as hell week, Brad finds things taking a violent turn as he has to endure a series of brutal initiation rituals. Fact-based drama, with Ben Schnetzer and Nick Jonas

programme.title: Iona
programme.desc: A woman fleeing the aftermath of a violent crime seeks refuge on the Scottish island where she grew up, bringing her teenage son with her. Her return has serious ramifications for the friends she left behind, while the boy grows to understand a simpler way of life than he is used to and discovers why his mother rebelled against it. Drama, starring Ruth Negga and Douglas Henshall

programme.title: The Goob
programme.desc: A teenager spends every summer helping out in his mother's cafe and working on the harvest in the nearby pumpkin fields. The latest harvest season proves a very different one, as tension brews with his mother's new boyfriend and a flirtatious relationship with a foreign worker in the fields makes him consider a different future. Drama, starring Liam Walpole and Marama Corlett

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Upcoming films

programme.title: The Wonders
programme.desc: The lives of a family of bee keepers living in isolation in central Italy are disturbed by the arrival of a troubled teenage boy, who has been taken on as a farmhand, and a television production crew. Against her father's wishes, Gelsomina enters the family onto a reality TV show about traditional Italian food. Drama, starring Alba Rohrwacher. In Italian

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: An obsessive surveillance expert makes the unprofessional mistake of getting personally involved in a dangerous case. Francis Ford Coppola's thriller, starring Gene Hackman, John Cazale, Robert Duvall, Allen Garfield and Harrison Ford

programme.title: Journey to the Shore
programme.desc: A wife's husband returns to her three years after he drowned at sea, and she agrees to let him take her on a journey. Drama, starring Eri Fukatsu and Tadanobu Asano

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A hard-working family man discovers that his six-year-old son was accidentally mixed up with another baby at birth. As he considers how to resolve the situation, the devotion of his wife and the other family involved to the children they have raised makes him wonder if he has been a good father. Drama, starring Masaharu Fukuyama and Machiko Ono. In Japanese

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: A cockney lothario leads a charmed life, enjoying casual sex with as many women as possible with no thought of the consequences. However, a series of unexpected setbacks forces him to finally take stock of his life. Comedy drama based on the play by Bill Naughton, starring Michael Caine, Jane Asher, Millicent Martin, Shirley Anne Field, Shelley Winters and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: The Wonders
programme.desc: The lives of a family of bee keepers living in isolation in central Italy are disturbed by the arrival of a troubled teenage boy, who has been taken on as a farmhand, and a television production crew. Against her father's wishes, Gelsomina enters the family onto a reality TV show about traditional Italian food. Drama, starring Alba Rohrwacher. In Italian

programme.title: The Conversation
programme.desc: An obsessive surveillance expert makes the unprofessional mistake of getting personally involved in a dangerous case. Francis Ford Coppola's thriller, starring Gene Hackman, John Cazale, Robert Duvall, Allen Garfield and Harrison Ford

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: American officer Aldo Raine leads a squad of soldiers into occupied France on a mission to kill as many Nazis as possible and spread fear through the Third Reich. They become involved in a Jewish resistance fighter's plan to blow up the premiere of a propaganda movie - due to be attended by Hitler himself. Quentin Tarantino's wartime adventure, with Brad Pitt, Melanie Laurent, Diane Kruger, Michael Fassbender and an Oscar-winning Christoph Waltz

programme.title: The Panic in Needle Park
programme.desc: A drug addict and dealer living in a dangerous neighbourhood of New York meets a troubled woman recovering from a botched abortion. They begin a relationship that inevitably leads to her joining him in heroin addiction as a short supply of narcotics leads to tension on the streets. Drama, starring Al Pacino and Kitty Winn

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance

programme.title: Like Father, Like Son
programme.desc: A hard-working family man discovers that his six-year-old son was accidentally mixed up with another baby at birth. As he considers how to resolve the situation, the devotion of his wife and the other family involved to the children they have raised makes him wonder if he has been a good father. Drama, starring Masaharu Fukuyama and Machiko Ono. In Japanese

programme.title: Theeb
programme.desc: A Bedouin boy living in an Ottoman province during the First World War offers to help his brother guide a British officer on a perilous journey through the desert to a secret destination. He gradually becomes more aware of the devastating events occurring in the world around him and is forced to grow up quickly. Drama, starring Jacir Eid Al-Hwietat and Jack Fox. In Arabic

programme.title: Maggie
programme.desc: A virus sweeps across America turning people into zombies, and the government establishes measures to capture those infected and dispose of them once the process is complete. When a teenage girl is infected, her devoted father refuses to hand her over to the authorities, and vows to defend her to the bitter end. Horror, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Abigail Breslin

programme.title: The Burning
programme.desc: A mysterious man attempts to rescue a young woman who has been kidnapped by the mercenaries who murdered her father and took control of his farm. Argentinean Western drama, starring Gael Garcia Bernal, Alice Braga and Claudio Tolcachir

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Two middle-aged men embark on a wine-tasting tour in California a week before one of them is due to be married. The groom-to-be is determined to persuade his self-hating, embittered friend to loosen up - while also making it clear he intends to cheat on his fiancee before the week is out. Comedy, starring Paul Giamatti, Thomas Haden Church, Virginia Madsen and Sandra Oh

programme.title: An Affair to Remember
programme.desc: Love blossoms on the high seas for a playboy bachelor and a former nightclub singer during a transatlantic cruise. When the liner comes into dock at New York, they agree to wait for six months and then meet again at the Empire State Building, hoping to prove to each other their relationship is more than a shipboard affair. Romantic drama, with Cary Grant, Deborah Kerr, Cathleen Nesbitt, Richard Denning and Neva Patterson

programme.title: Queen of Earth
programme.desc: Grieving after the death of her father, a troubled woman retreats to her best friend's lake house and spirals into despair. Psychological thriller, starring Elisabeth Moss, Katherine Waterston and Patrick Fugit

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander

programme.title: Moneyball
programme.desc: The manager of a struggling baseball team faces disaster, as his star players are bought out by richer clubs and he is unable to afford to replace them. An economics student offers him a solution to his problems, finding a ground-breaking way to analyse the performance of cheaper players and combining their abilities to form a winning side. Fact-based drama, starring Brad Pitt, Jonah Hill and Philip Seymour Hoffman

programme.title: Spy Game
programme.desc: A veteran CIA agent is on the verge of retirement, but when he learns his former protege has been thrown into a Chinese prison and is awaiting execution, he decides to launch a perilous and ill-advised rescue attempt. Thriller, starring Brad Pitt, Robert Redford, Catherine McCormack and Stephen Dillane

programme.title: Out of Sight
programme.desc: A charming bank robber breaks out of jail and takes a female US Marshal hostage. Managing to escape, she sets out to track him down as he prepares for one last job - but as the chase intensifies, so do their feelings for each other. Steven Soderbergh's romantic crime drama, based on Elmore Leonard's novel, with George Clooney, Jennifer Lopez, Ving Rhames and Don Cheadle(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander(n)

programme.title: Roustabout
programme.desc: A leather-clad drifter with a talent for all things tuneful joins a travelling carnival, and catches the eye of a co-worker - but her father is less less than keen on the relationship, leading to trouble. Musical, starring Elvis Presley, Barbara Stanwyck, Joan Freeman, Leif Erickson and Sue Ann Langdon(n)

programme.title: Four Corners
programme.desc: A 13-year-old boy raised in South Africa's Cape Flats gets caught up in a volatile subculture dominated by two rival gangs. Thriller, starring Brendon Daniels, Jezriel Skei and Lindiwe Matshikiza(n)

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara(n)

programme.title: One Hour Photo
programme.desc: A lonely photo technician develops an increasing obsession with a seemingly perfect couple and their child, whose pictures he processes - but when he uncovers evidence of marital infidelity, he resolves to expose the truth, regardless of the cost. Psychological thriller, starring Robin Williams, Connie Nielsen, Michael Vartan, Gary Cole and Dylan Smith(n)

programme.title: The Brand New Testament
programme.desc: God secretly lives in Brussels, spending his time enacting spiteful punishments on the human race. His rebellious daughter tries to teach him a lesson by sending everyone on Earth a message containing the date of their death. As the world is plunged into chaos, she flees from her furious father - who gains a new insight into his creation. Comedy, starring Pili Groyne, Benoit Poelvoorde and Catherine Deneuve. In French and German(n)

programme.title: The Bible
programme.desc: John Huston's epic re-telling of the Book of Genesis, chronicling the stories of Adam and Eve, Noah and the flood and Abraham and Isaac. Starring Richard Harris, Peter O'Toole, Michael Parks, Ava Gardner, George C Scott and Huston himself as the voice of God(n)

programme.title: The Great Escape
programme.desc: The most rebellious Allied prisoners of war are sent to a supposedly escape-proof maximum-security detention camp during the Second World War. They plan an ingenious mass breakout by digging a tunnel, but even when free of the camp, making it across occupied Europe proves a dangerous journey. Drama, starring Steve McQueen, James Coburn, Donald Pleasence, James Garner, Charles Bronson and Richard Attenborough(n)

programme.title: The Darjeeling Limited
programme.desc: Three brothers drift apart after their father's death. A year later, the eldest arranges for the other two to join him on a soul-searching trip across India to rebuild their relationship and track down their estranged mother. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Owen Wilson, Adrien Brody, Jason Schwartzman and Anjelica Huston(n)

programme.title: Raging Bull
programme.desc: Biopic of boxer Jake LaMotta, who rose to fame as the world middleweight champion in the 1940s. His career was marred by an inability to deal with his anger, leaving his family bearing the brunt of his rage and paranoia. Directed by Martin Scorsese and starring an Oscar-winning Robert De Niro alongside Joe Pesci and Cathy Moriarty(n)

programme.title: Eyes Wide Shut
programme.desc: A successful doctor is shocked to discover his wife once harboured feelings for another man and resolves to get even by embarking on an affair of his own - only to end up involved with a dangerous exclusive cult. Stanley Kubrick's drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Sydney Pollack and Marie Richardson(n)

programme.title: The Sacrifice
programme.desc: As his family gathers to celebrate his birthday as the threat of nuclear war looms, disillusioned intellectual Alexander tries to strike a bargain with God. Andrei Tarkovsky's final drama, starring Erland Josephson, Susan Fleetwood and Allan Edwall. In Swedish, French and English

programme.title: Winchester '73
programme.desc: A gunslinger tracks down his father's killer, but is unable to exact his revenge because the sheriff of the town makes a point of confiscating all firearms. Instead he challenges him to compete in a shooting competition to win a superb rifle, but when the murderer loses, he steals the coveted prize. Western, starring James Stewart, Shelley Winters, Dan Duryea and Stephen McNally

programme.title: 3:10 to Yuma
programme.desc: A farmer in need of money agrees to guard a notorious outlaw until the train arrives to transport him to jail. Meanwhile, the pair are holed up in a hotel, where his prisoner plays mind games with him - and the villain's cohorts are waiting outside ready to engineer an escape. Western adapted from a novel by Elmore Leonard, with Van Heflin, Glenn Ford, Felicia Farr and Leora Dana

programme.title: Guadalcanal Diary
programme.desc: A tough sergeant, a chaplain and two marines fight through a series of battles on the Solomon Islands during the initial skirmishes of the American forces' Pacific campaign. Second World War drama, based on the book by Richard Tregaskis, starring Preston Foster, Anthony Quinn, Lloyd Nolan, William Bendix and Richard Conte

programme.title: The Bridges at Toko-Ri
programme.desc: An American naval reserve pilot is called up for service in the Korean War, and must leave his family and civilian job as a lawyer. In command of a corps of naval pilots, he heads a bombing campaign on strategic Communist positions, but later comes to question the morality of the conflict. Adventure, starring William Holden, Grace Kelly, Fredric March and Mickey Rooney

programme.title: A Good Year
programme.desc: A city trader inherits a French vineyard from his deceased uncle. But when he goes to France to get a valuation on his newly acquired property so he can sell it, a series of unexpected events leads him to reassess his priorities in life. Ridley Scott's comedy drama based on Peter Mayle's novel, starring Russell Crowe, Albert Finney, Abbie Cornish and Marion Cotillard

programme.title: The Bourne Legacy
programme.desc: The leaders of a secret government agency plan to eliminate several agents as part of a cover-up when they face having their dark secrets exposed. One of the assassins targeted is able to evade his fate and go on the run - but his escape is threatened by his dependence on drugs to boost his physical and mental capabilities. Spy thriller sequel, with Jeremy Renner, Rachel Weisz and Edward Norton

programme.title: Contraband
programme.desc: Successful international smuggler Chris Farraday turns his back on a life of crime to raise a family. However, his brother-in-law crosses a powerful drug lord, who forces Chris to transport billions of dollars of counterfeit money into the US, or his wife and children will be killed. Crime thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg, Kate Beckinsale, Giovanni Ribisi and Ben Foster

programme.title: Perrier's Bounty
programme.desc: A man borrows money from a loan shark, but ends up with a price on his head when he cannot pay it back. In desperation, he joins a gang of thieves to raise the money, but when a simple robbery goes horribly wrong, finds himself with a second lot of crooks on his trail. Comedy thriller, starring Cillian Murphy, Brendan Gleeson and Jim Broadbent

programme.title: The Black Knight
programme.desc: A humble sword-maker in the kingdom of King Arthur sets out to prove his worth as a knight in a bid to impress a nobleman's daughter. While fighting to foil an invasion, he discovers the attacking army is in league with traitors in the royal court. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Alan Ladd, Peter Cushing, Patricia Medina, Patrick Troughton and John Laurie

programme.title: Apache Territory
programme.desc: A drifter takes the lone survivor of a massacred party of settlers to an oasis, where he finds several other homesteaders and a military force have also sought shelter. They come under siege by a war party of Apaches, and face a struggle for survival - but an impending storm inspires a daring escape plan. Western, starring Rory Calhoun and Barbara Bates

programme.title: The Best of Benny Hill
programme.desc: Compilation of the comedian's sketches from episodes of his television series between 1969 and 1972. Featuring appearances by Nicholas Parsons, Jenny Lee Wright, Rita Webb, Patricia Hayes, Bob Todd, Henry McGee and Connie Georges

programme.title: Twelve O'Clock High
programme.desc: A US Air Force officer takes command of a bomber squadron based in England, and has to suppress his humane instincts to restore morale and discipline - a task which places a heavy strain on his mental state and brings his weary men to the edge of endurance. Oscar-winning Second World War drama, with Gregory Peck, Hugh Marlowe, Gary Merrill and Dean Jagger

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Vampire Edward abandons his human girlfriend Bella, believing she will never be safe around him. As Bella is plunged into misery, she finds comfort in the arms of an old friend - only to discover he also has a supernatural nature, being part of a tribe of werewolves. Part two of the romantic fantasy series, starring Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner and Michael Sheen

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton

programme.title: Wyrmwood: Road of the Dead
programme.desc: Mechanic Barry's life implodes after getting a distressed call from his sister Brooke, who has just survived a crazed attack by two of her two friends. He discovers a zombie apocalypse has broken out and flees to the Outback where he joins fellow survivors Benny and Frank and uses his engineering skills to assemble makeshift armour and weapons, contending not only with the undead but also with sinister gasmask-wearing scientists and military men. Action horror, starring Jay Gallagher

programme.title: Legend
programme.desc: A peasant boy, who has a special bond with animals and fairies, shows his sweetheart the last surviving unicorns. Unfortunately, a monstrous demon and his goblin henchmen despise the mythical creatures and trick the girl into harming one of them, forcing Jack to act quickly to save her immortal soul. Ridley Scott's fantasy adventure, starring Tom Cruise, Mia Sara, Tim Curry and David Bennent(n)

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter captures young killer Billy John, but his real motive is not the cash reward - he has an old score to settle with his prisoner's brother Frank. As the journey to bring the murderer to justice gets under way, he is counting on a showdown with Frank and accepts the help of two outlaw gunmen for added protection, aware they will try to turn Billy John in themselves for the reward and a pardon. Western, with Randolph Scott, Lee Van Cleef, James Best, James Coburn and Pernell Roberts(n)

programme.title: Lonely Are the Brave
programme.desc: A rebellious modern-day cowboy breaks out of jail and escapes on horseback - but reckons without the relentlessness of the authorities, who give chase by car and helicopter. A dogged sheriff leads the pursuit, coming to sympathise with his quarry. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Gena Rowlands and George Kennedy(n)

programme.title: Carry On Teacher
programme.desc: A headmaster hopes to land a more prestigious job at a better school, but his pupils do not want him to leave. When two inspectors pay a visit, the mischievous students see a chance to sabotage his career plans with a series of pranks. Comedy, starring Ted Ray, Kenneth Connor, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams(n)

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: A naive country boy arrives in Paris, keen to seek adventure and prove himself a swordsman. He falls in with a trio of roguish soldiers, and together they set out to save the queen from the schemes of a treacherous cardinal. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Oliver Reed, Michael York, Richard Chamberlain, Frank Finlay, Charlton Heston and Faye Dunaway(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: Bella Swan's confused feelings for vampire Edward and werewolf Jacob threaten to ignite a conflict between the two supernatural races. Meanwhile, a series of murders heralds the return of an old enemy, who has raised an army to aid her quest for revenge. Third part of the romantic fantasy series, with Kristen Stewart, Robert Pattinson, Taylor Lautner and Bryce Dallas Howard(n)

programme.title: Salt
programme.desc: A CIA agent is accused of being a sleeper assassin with a deadly purpose - to kill the Russian president during a diplomatic visit and start a third world war. She goes on the run, with her colleagues in hot pursuit - but each attempt to prove her innocence only raises more questions about her identity. Action thriller, starring Angelina Jolie, Liev Schreiber and Chiwetel Ejiofor(n)

programme.title: Snake Eyes
programme.desc: A corrupt cop seals off all exits in a casino after the fatal shooting of a US Defence Department official - but while frantically searching for the assassin among the 14,000-strong crowd, he is daunted by the sheer scale of the challenge. Thriller from director Brian De Palma, starring Nicolas Cage, Gary Sinise, John Heard and Carla Gugino(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A forestry student visits the family, and Mary Ellen and Erin both fall for him

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura quits her teaching job, leaving the children to face the tender mercies of Mrs Oleson, who immediately sets about making changes to the curriculum

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Albert falls for a traumatised schoolgirl hiding a terrible secret, but her father tries to put a stop to their relationship, forcing them to meet in secret

programme.title: The Scarlet and the Black
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama about Monsignor Hugh O'Flaherty, a cleric who rescued thousands of PoWs and Italian resistance fighters from the Gestapo. Starring Gregory Peck, Christopher Plummer and John Gielgud

programme.title: The Christmas Stallion
programme.desc: A 16-year-old girl adores the horses she and her grandfather have raised in the Welsh mountains, but when her grandfather dies, a tragic past is revealed. Drama, starring Daniel J Travanti, Lynette Davies and Sian MacLean

programme.title: Charms for the Easy Life
programme.desc: A self-educated freethinking woman takes in her adult daughter and grandchild, and encourages them both to follow their dreams. While the grandmother is busy with an ongoing feud with a local doctor, the two younger women overcome their distrust of men and begin to fall in love - one with a lawyer, the other with a wounded soldier. Period drama set in the 1930s, with Gena Rowlands, Mimi Rogers, Susan May Pratt and Kenneth Mitchell

programme.title: Just Breathe
programme.desc: Unruly teenager Sydney's endless partying and shoplifting prompts her distraught single mother to take drastic action - she sends her daughter to live with her father and his pregnant wife. At first Sydney rebels against her new life, but when she befriends a local girl whose mum has died of cancer, she begins to appreciate how lucky she is to have a loving family. Drama, with Brittney Wilson, Melora Hardin and Paul McGillion

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia gets a job working for a dressmaker, but as her responsibilities grow, she starts to miss leading a simple life

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: I'll Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Ingalls family faces yet more tribulation as Mary's eyesight deteriorates. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: A battered wife with three children is persuaded by her sister to leave her abusive husband, but he continues to subject her to a barrage of harassment and threats - until the situation culminates in a fatal confrontation that changes the lives of all involved. Drama, starring Isabella Hofmann, Seth Adkins, Tracy Nelson and Matt Cooke

programme.title: Sleeping with the Devil
programme.desc: A woman's life is turned upside down by the discovery that her seemingly perfect boyfriend is psychotically unbalanced and, as his mania increases, he pays a killer to gun her down. Drama, starring Shannen Doherty, Tim Matheson, Bonnie Bartlett and Steve Eastin

programme.title: Hollywood Wives: The New Generation
programme.desc: A Hollywood star becomes convinced her husband is cheating on her, so hires a private eye to discover the truth. Meanwhile, a director's wife has an affair with an aspiring writer and a soul singer tries to form a closer relationship with her daughter. Drama, based on Jackie Collins' novel, starring Farrah Fawcett, Robin Givens and Melissa Gilbert

programme.title: Roots: The Next Generations
programme.desc: Alex is hired to write Malcolm X's biography and when the activist is murdered, he turns his attention to his own family history. With James Earl Jones

programme.title: Telling Secrets
programme.desc: Part one of two. A woman is shocked to learn of her husband's infidelity, and her reaction leaves a lot to be desired as she vows to hunt down the other woman and kill her. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Ken Olin and Christopher McDonald

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A new pupil at the school has troubled reading, but Elizabeth realises why and finds a way to help him

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When young widow Olivia comes to stay in their home, the Walton children learn a hard lesson about how to cope with another person's grief

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Adam and Mary Kendall return to Walnut Grove to set up a law practice. However, their first client proves controversial with the neighbours

programme.title: In the Arms of a Killer
programme.desc: A rookie homicide cop lands herself in a dilemma after making the foolish mistake of becoming romantically involved with the prime suspect in a drug-related murder case. Thriller, starring Jaclyn Smith, John Spencer, Michael Nouri, Nina Foch and Sandahl Bergman

programme.title: Beverly Hills Christmas
programme.desc: A spoiled, rich teenager is given a lesson in the true meaning of Christmas when she is visited by a guardian angel, who tries to teach her that true value is found in assisting others, and not in material things. Festive drama, starring Donna Spangler, Dean Cain and Simona Fusco

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange

programme.title: Have You Seen My Son
programme.desc: A woman strives to find her sick son after he is kidnapped by her ex-husband. Drama, starring Lisa Hartman Black, William Russ, Jameson Parker, Anne Francis and Scott Hylands

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma organises a traditional quilting as Mary Ellen's birthday approaches, but Mary Ellen rejects the custom as demeaning to her

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: I'll Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary becomes bitter about losing her sight, prompting Charles to enrol her in a school for the blind

programme.title: The Flood: Who Will Save Our Children
programme.desc: A coach full of children from a Texas summer camp is endangered by rising flood waters, prompting a daring rescue attempt by local villagers. Drama, starring Joe Spano, David Lascher, Michael A Goorjian and Amy Van Nostrand

programme.title: Missing Children: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: A dodgy adoption agency resorts to underhand tactics in an attempt to take away a woman's children. Drama, starring Mare Winningham, Polly Holliday, Kate Capshaw and John Anderson

programme.title: Riders
programme.desc: Adaptation of Jilly Cooper's racy novel about love, lust and rivalry in the ritzy world of international showjumping. Michael Praed and Marcus Gilbert star as the riders who have been bitter enemies since childhood, and are now competing for women and the chance to become champions of the equestrian world. With Stephanie Beacham, Anthony Valentine and Caroline Harker

programme.title: Roots: The Gift
programme.desc: Two slaves in 18th-century America are taken to a plantation, where they discover the son of the owner is secretly helping his father's captive workforce to escape - giving them the chance to gain their freedom. Period drama based on the TV series, starring LeVar Burton, Louis Gossett Jr and Avery Brooks

programme.title: Telling Secrets
programme.desc: Part two of two. A woman is shocked to learn of her husband's infidelity, and her reaction leaves a lot to be desired as she vows to hunt down the other woman and kill her. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Ken Olin and Christopher McDonald

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A movie is being filmed in town. John-Boy offers to changed the dialogue to make it more authentic - which results in the writer, who is an old friend, getting fired(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Caroline convinces herself she is going to have another baby, but Doc Baker tells her she is clutching at straws and will never have any more children. To cheer her up, Charles arranges for them to renew their wedding vows. Drama, starring Michael Landon(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles and Albert go on a delivery run and meet the Cooper family. Whilst tackling a steep hill, Alvin loses control of his wagon leading to a tragic accident. Charles later sends two children to live in a distant orphanage, but then begins to have doubts about what he's done(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Heroes
programme.desc: Tense drama based on the real-life story of a heroic pilot forced to make a spectacular emergency landing in Iowa, and the ground staff's attempts to save all 296 people on board his aircraft. Charlton Heston, James Coburn and Richard Thomas star(n)

programme.title: November Christmas
programme.desc: A father whose daughter is seriously ill fears she will not live through the year. He is determined to make sure her remaining time is happy, and with the help of his neighbours, he arranges to celebrate Halloween and Christmas months ahead of schedule so she can enjoy both holidays. Drama, starring John Corbett and Sam Elliott(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk(n)

programme.title: A Nightmare Come True
programme.desc: A nurse tries to persuade her mother to leave her cruel father, but has little success. On another visit home, it seems she has finally taken her advice and left. But when the nurse starts to suffer horrific recurring nightmares, she becomes certain her mother has been murdered. Psychological thriller, starring Katy Boyer, Gerald McRaney and Shelley Fabares(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma rallies the community to save an old house from demolition, unaware that Grandpa has secured the contract to knock it down(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: As Long as We're Together - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The recession catches up with the Ingalls, forcing the family to seek fresh pastures - but fortunately the move brings them closer to Mary(n)

programme.title: Heart of a Child
programme.desc: The longed-for pregnancies of two women hit complications, and doctors face a race against time to save the unborn children. Fact-based drama, starring Ann Jillian, Michelle Greene, Terry O'Quinn, Bruce Greenwood and Andrew Wheeler(n)

programme.title: No Higher Love
programme.desc: A woman's joy at a long-awaited pregnancy is shattered by the discovery that she has an inoperable tumour, forcing her to put aside her grief and make provisions for her baby and husband. Drama, starring Katey Sagal, Annabeth Gish and Tom Irwin(n)

programme.title: Diamond Girl
programme.desc: An American playboy lawyer is caught up in a love triangle when his well-intentioned brother pairs him off with his doting paralegal assistant, in a ruse to prise him out of the clutches of his vampish and predatory business adviser. Romantic drama, starring Kevin Otto, Joely Collins, Jonathan Cake, Denise Virieux and Dyan Cannon(n)

programme.title: Queen
programme.desc: Historical drama telling the life story of a young slave girl named Queen, whose skin tone allowed her to pass herself off as a white woman. Based on the novel Queen: The Story of an American Family by Alex Haley and David Stevens. Starring Halle Berry, Danny Glover, Tucker Stone, Jasmine Guy, Tim Daly, Martin Sheen, Paul Winfield, Raven-Symone and Ann-Margret(n)

programme.title: Willing to Kill: The Texas Cheerleader Story
programme.desc: A desperate desire for victory drives a woman to take extreme action against the mother of her daughter's rival in a cheerleading competition. Fact-based drama, starring Lesley Ann Warren, Tess Harper and Dennis Christopher(n)

programme.title: No One Would Tell
programme.desc: A shy teenager thinks all her dreams have come true when the school's star athlete asks her out. However, the relationship soon turns sour as her seemingly perfect boyfriend becomes possessive, controlling and violent. Drama, starring Fred Savage, Candace Cameron Bure, Gregory Alan Williams and Rodney Eastman

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair

programme.desc: Part one of two. The Ingalls family faces yet more tribulation as Mary's eyesight deteriorates. Drama, starring Michael Landon

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: A battered wife with three children is persuaded by her sister to leave her abusive husband, but he continues to subject her to a barrage of harassment and threats - until the situation culminates in a fatal confrontation that changes the lives of all involved. Drama, starring Isabella Hofmann, Seth Adkins, Tracy Nelson and Matt Cooke

programme.title: Sleeping with the Devil
programme.desc: A woman's life is turned upside down by the discovery that her seemingly perfect boyfriend is psychotically unbalanced and, as his mania increases, he pays a killer to gun her down. Drama, starring Shannen Doherty, Tim Matheson, Bonnie Bartlett and Steve Eastin

programme.title: Hollywood Wives: The New Generation
programme.desc: A Hollywood star becomes convinced her husband is cheating on her, so hires a private eye to discover the truth. Meanwhile, a director's wife has an affair with an aspiring writer and a soul singer tries to form a closer relationship with her daughter. Drama, based on Jackie Collins' novel, starring Farrah Fawcett, Robin Givens and Melissa Gilbert

programme.title: Roots: The Next Generations
programme.desc: Alex is hired to write Malcolm X's biography and when the activist is murdered, he turns his attention to his own family history. With James Earl Jones

programme.title: Telling Secrets
programme.desc: Part one of two. A woman is shocked to learn of her husband's infidelity, and her reaction leaves a lot to be desired as she vows to hunt down the other woman and kill her. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Ken Olin and Christopher McDonald

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A new pupil at the school has troubled reading, but Elizabeth realises why and finds a way to help him

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: When young widow Olivia comes to stay in their home, the Walton children learn a hard lesson about how to cope with another person's grief

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Albert helps Sylvia to run away so she will not have to leave Walnut Grove with her father, but unknowingly reveals her whereabouts to the rapist

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Adam and Mary Kendall return to Walnut Grove to set up a law practice. However, their first client proves controversial with the neighbours

programme.title: In the Arms of a Killer
programme.desc: A rookie homicide cop lands herself in a dilemma after making the foolish mistake of becoming romantically involved with the prime suspect in a drug-related murder case. Thriller, starring Jaclyn Smith, John Spencer, Michael Nouri, Nina Foch and Sandahl Bergman

programme.title: Beverly Hills Christmas
programme.desc: A spoiled, rich teenager is given a lesson in the true meaning of Christmas when she is visited by a guardian angel, who tries to teach her that true value is found in assisting others, and not in material things. Festive drama, starring Donna Spangler, Dean Cain and Simona Fusco

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange

programme.title: Have You Seen My Son
programme.desc: A woman strives to find her sick son after he is kidnapped by her ex-husband. Drama, starring Lisa Hartman Black, William Russ, Jameson Parker, Anne Francis and Scott Hylands

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma organises a traditional quilting as Mary Ellen's birthday approaches, but Mary Ellen rejects the custom as demeaning to her

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: I'll Be Waving as You Drive Away - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mary becomes bitter about losing her sight, prompting Charles to enrol her in a school for the blind

programme.title: The Flood: Who Will Save Our Children
programme.desc: A coach full of children from a Texas summer camp is endangered by rising flood waters, prompting a daring rescue attempt by local villagers. Drama, starring Joe Spano, David Lascher, Michael A Goorjian and Amy Van Nostrand

programme.title: Missing Children: A Mother's Story
programme.desc: A dodgy adoption agency resorts to underhand tactics in an attempt to take away a woman's children. Drama, starring Mare Winningham, Polly Holliday, Kate Capshaw and John Anderson

programme.title: Riders
programme.desc: Adaptation of Jilly Cooper's racy novel about love, lust and rivalry in the ritzy world of international showjumping. Michael Praed and Marcus Gilbert star as the riders who have been bitter enemies since childhood, and are now competing for women and the chance to become champions of the equestrian world. With Stephanie Beacham, Anthony Valentine and Caroline Harker

programme.title: Roots: The Gift
programme.desc: Two slaves in 18th-century America are taken to a plantation, where they discover the son of the owner is secretly helping his father's captive workforce to escape - giving them the chance to gain their freedom. Period drama based on the TV series, starring LeVar Burton, Louis Gossett Jr and Avery Brooks

programme.title: Telling Secrets
programme.desc: Part two of two. A woman is shocked to learn of her husband's infidelity, and her reaction leaves a lot to be desired as she vows to hunt down the other woman and kill her. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Ken Olin and Christopher McDonald(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A movie is being filmed in town. John-Boy offers to changed the dialogue to make it more authentic - which results in the writer, who is an old friend, getting fired(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A cousin of the family arrives with her baby, having left her husband whom she believes is being unfaithful(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Caroline convinces herself she is going to have another baby, but Doc Baker tells her she is clutching at straws and will never have any more children. To cheer her up, Charles arranges for them to renew their wedding vows. Drama, starring Michael Landon(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part one of two. Charles and Albert go on a delivery run and meet the Cooper family. Whilst tackling a steep hill, Alvin loses control of his wagon leading to a tragic accident. Charles later sends two children to live in a distant orphanage, but then begins to have doubts about what he's done(n)

programme.title: A Thousand Heroes
programme.desc: Tense drama based on the real-life story of a heroic pilot forced to make a spectacular emergency landing in Iowa, and the ground staff's attempts to save all 296 people on board his aircraft. Charlton Heston, James Coburn and Richard Thomas star(n)

programme.title: November Christmas
programme.desc: A father whose daughter is seriously ill fears she will not live through the year. He is determined to make sure her remaining time is happy, and with the help of his neighbours, he arranges to celebrate Halloween and Christmas months ahead of schedule so she can enjoy both holidays. Drama, starring John Corbett and Sam Elliott(n)

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk(n)

programme.title: A Nightmare Come True
programme.desc: A nurse tries to persuade her mother to leave her cruel father, but has little success. On another visit home, it seems she has finally taken her advice and left. But when the nurse starts to suffer horrific recurring nightmares, she becomes certain her mother has been murdered. Psychological thriller, starring Katy Boyer, Gerald McRaney and Shelley Fabares(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma rallies the community to save an old house from demolition, unaware that Grandpa has secured the contract to knock it down(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: As Long as We're Together - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. The recession catches up with the Ingalls, forcing the family to seek fresh pastures - but fortunately the move brings them closer to Mary(n)

programme.title: Heart of a Child
programme.desc: The longed-for pregnancies of two women hit complications, and doctors face a race against time to save the unborn children. Fact-based drama, starring Ann Jillian, Michelle Greene, Terry O'Quinn, Bruce Greenwood and Andrew Wheeler(n)

programme.title: No Higher Love
programme.desc: A woman's joy at a long-awaited pregnancy is shattered by the discovery that she has an inoperable tumour, forcing her to put aside her grief and make provisions for her baby and husband. Drama, starring Katey Sagal, Annabeth Gish and Tom Irwin(n)

programme.title: Diamond Girl
programme.desc: An American playboy lawyer is caught up in a love triangle when his well-intentioned brother pairs him off with his doting paralegal assistant, in a ruse to prise him out of the clutches of his vampish and predatory business adviser. Romantic drama, starring Kevin Otto, Joely Collins, Jonathan Cake, Denise Virieux and Dyan Cannon(n)

programme.title: Queen
programme.desc: Historical drama telling the life story of a young slave girl named Queen, whose skin tone allowed her to pass herself off as a white woman. Based on the novel Queen: The Story of an American Family by Alex Haley and David Stevens. Starring Halle Berry, Danny Glover, Tucker Stone, Jasmine Guy, Tim Daly, Martin Sheen, Paul Winfield, Raven-Symone and Ann-Margret(n)

In the wake of a tragic loss, Marcus and Jas' relationship is tested. Planning their final action, the gang reach out to someone from the black community that they initially spurned. In London, meanwhile, Kent's actions have a disastrous effect on the radical community, at a time when the Black Power Desk's reign of terror hits new heights - with Cullen now at the helm. Marginalized and overlooked, Pence begins to plan his escape

credits.director: Graphic Language, Graphic Violence, Adult Content, Nudity

programme.desc: Infighting and external forces threaten to split the gang, throwing their final mission into jeopardy. Fallon colludes with the Black Power Desk, now being led by Cullen. Dhari and Marcus fight for the position of alpha male. Jas, determined, gathers materials for their ultimate action. Meanwhile, unbeknownst to Jas, Marcus receives news that threatens to destroy their relationship - and their final mission. Limited series finale

credits.director: Graphic Language, Graphic Violence, Adult Content

programme.title: My Home
programme.desc: The digital era offers us new technologies to protect ourselves, but are these devices defending our homes or making them more vulnerable? In this episode meet a woman whose home is invaded by a Ratter, a digital stalker who gains entry through her laptop; enter a neighborhood where residents are battling over proposed camera surveillance to monitor everyone's coming and goings; and a sex offender who received the ultimate punishment for invading his victims' privacy - life under constant surveillance

programme.title: The American
programme.desc: Academy Award® winner George Clooney stars as an assassin who hides out in an idyllic Italian town, performing one last hit before leaving the death trade in this elegiac thriller from director Anton Corbijn

programme.title: The Hurt Locker
programme.desc: The Academy Awards® for Best Picture, Best Director and Best Original Screenplay went to this gritty war drama about a psychologically unglued bomb removal expert plying his trade in Iraq while his crew becomes increasingly unnerved by his cowboy recklessness. Jeremy Renner, Anthony Mackie and Brian Geraghty star in this acclaimed, tension-filled journey into the heart of darkness

programme.title: National Lampoon's Van Wilder - The Rise of Taj
programme.desc: Kal Penn stars in this sequel to the comedy smash "Van Wilder" as the protege to a legendary party animal, who sets out to prove his skills by transforming a stodgy British school of higher learning into the new Eurpean capital of rowdy, raunchy fun

programme.title: Gringo: The Dangerous Life of John McAfee
programme.desc: Documentary about the bizarre and scandalous life of tech millionaire John McAfee - famed inventor of anti-virus software - who goes off the grid to live in Belize, building a compound and harem, becoming a drug lord and developing an armed security force to guard himself against the police until he is a suspect in his neighbor's murder and must make a great escape

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: Christmas Eve hijinks put Frank Cross (Bill Murray) in a ghostly time warp in this take-off of Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol." Cross, who has made the meteoric rise from the depths of the mailroom to TV network president, is a modern-day Scrooge. Before the night is over he'll be visited by a maniacal New York cab driver from the past, a present-day fairy who's into pratfalls and, finally, a ghoulish, seven-foot headless messenger from the future

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee In Los Angeles
programme.desc: Mick Dundee (Paul Hogan) is back in this sequel that finds the famed crocodile hunter relocating with his lady love Sue (Linda Kozlowski) and their son to the urban jungle of Los Angeles, where Sue takes over her father's newspaper while Mick and his boy are soon up to their necks in trouble investigating a mystery. Paul Rodriguez costars in this warmly funny follow-up

programme.title: Diary of a Mad Black Woman
programme.desc: Tyler Perry wrote and costars in this box office smash about a divorcee (Kimberly Elise) who learns to trust and love again after a nasty break up with her arrogant and emotionally distant attorney husband, thanks to comically sage advice from her sassy grandmother Madea. Shemar Moore and Cicely Tyson costar

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: An inner-city single mother (Angela Bassett) packs up her kids and heads off to visit the crass but surprisingly sweet country cousins she never knew she had in this warm comedy costarring Rick Fox and Sofia Vergara

programme.title: Doom
programme.desc: Something has gone wrong at a remote scientific research station on Mars. Sealing off the portal to Earth, Sarge (Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson), Reaper (Karl Urban) and their team must use every weapon at their disposal—and some they find along the way—to carry out their orders: nothing gets out alive

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Tell The Damn Joke
programme.desc: He's a comic. A husband. A dad. An American. And on top of it all, he's hilarious. Steve Byrne brings his signature style to Chicago with an all-new comedy special that holds no punches, calls it like it is and tells the damn jokes

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Making Pet Sounds
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of the release of ‘Pet Sounds,' Brian Wilson and surviving members of The Beach Boys (Mike Love, Al Jardine, Bruce Johnston and David Marks) revisit the writing and recording of the landmark record that is consistently voted one of the top three influential albums of all time. Featuring exclusive interviews, classic archive and rare studio outtakes from the recording sessions

programme.title: Breach
programme.desc: Ryan Phillippe stars as an FBI agent assigned the job of doing surveillance on a senior agent whose sexual deviance may be compromising the agency. When he learns that his new boss is actually a spy, he becomes part of a massive sting operation to bring him to justice. Also starring Academy Award® winner Chris Cooper and Laura Linney

programme.title: Diary of a Mad Black Woman
programme.desc: Tyler Perry wrote and costars in this box office smash about a divorcee (Kimberly Elise) who learns to trust and love again after a nasty break up with her arrogant and emotionally distant attorney husband, thanks to comically sage advice from her sassy grandmother Madea. Shemar Moore and Cicely Tyson costar

programme.title: Al Madrigal: Shrimpin' Ain't Easy
programme.desc: Former 'Daily Show with Jon Stewart' correspondent Al Madrigal applies his comedic insight to relatable topics like cilantro politics, anger management, and an unbelievable tale of seafood revenge in this stand-up comedy special

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: An inner-city single mother (Angela Bassett) packs up her kids and heads off to visit the crass but surprisingly sweet country cousins she never knew she had in this warm comedy costarring Rick Fox and Sofia Vergara

programme.title: Martin Lawrence: Doin' Time: Uncut
programme.desc: Comedy legend Martin Lawrence returns to the stand-up stage for a night of impressions and insight on everything from sex, relationships and President Obama, to Bill Cosby, Hollywood and more. Filmed live at LA's Orpheum Theatre

programme.title: The Presidio
programme.desc: An ex-military policeman is now a San Francisco detective but when his former partner is killed at a military base, he takes the case. After arriving at the crime scene, he realizes he must look to his old rival for help. Stars Sean Connery, Mark Harmon and Meg Ryan

programme.title: Saw IV
programme.desc: The deranged fiend Jigsaw returns from beyond the grave to plague and torment one last crime investigator who can't let go of a new mystery that presents itself while the police are examining the killer's lair. Lyriq Bent, Scott Patterson, Costas Mandylor and Donnie Wahlberg star in the fourth (but by no means final) chapter of the "Saw" series

programme.title: Beyond the Sea
programme.desc: Kevin Spacey directs, stars in and does all his own singing for this lavish biography of music legend Bobby Darin, whose life and career is followed from the childhood illness that weakened his heart to the heights of fame as a crooner and movie star. Kate Bosworth costars as Darin's wife Sandra Dee along with John Goodman, Greta Scacchi, Bob Hoskins and Brenda Blethyn

programme.title: Down To Earth
programme.desc: Chris Rock is struggling comedian Lance Burton, who is taken long before his time by an anxious angel and finds temporary refuge back on Earth in the body of a prejudiced, white millionaire. Soon Lance ("Charles" to those who only know him by his new identity) is wooing a community rights activist (Regina King) and dodging a bullet as his wife and her lover try to kill him

programme.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit
programme.desc: Toon star Roger is worried that his wife Jessica is playing pattycake with someone else, so the studio hires detective Eddie Valiant to snoop on her. But when Marvin Acme turns up dead Roger becomes the prime suspect

programme.title: A Civil Action
programme.desc: John Travolta stars as Jan Schlichtmann, a cynical, high-priced personal injury attorney who only takes big-money cases he can safely settle out of court. Though his latest case appears straightforward, Jan soon becomes entangled in an epic legal battle on behalf of his clients - one where he's willing to put his career, reputation and all that he owns on the line. Robert Duvall, William H. Macy and John Lithgow co-star

programme.title: Shaun of the Dead
programme.desc: Shaun (Simon Pegg) and his friends are in for a literal night from hell when they meet up at the local pub only to find themselves fighting off hordes of brain-hungry undead. Penelope Wilton, Kate Ashfield, Lucy Davis and Bill Nighy co-star in this zombie-fraught romantic comedy

programme.title: Orange County
programme.desc: The stressful rite of passage known as the college admissions process is gleefully lampooned in this comedy starring Colin Hanks as privileged teen Shaun Brumder, whose sure-fire application to Stanford is botched by his scrambled guidance counselor, leaving him to repair the damage with his slacker brother Lance (Jack Black) and girlfriend Ashley (Schuyler Fisk)

programme.title: The Land
programme.desc: Teenage buddies Cisco (Jorge Lendeborg Jr.), Junior (Moises Arias), Boobie (Ezri Walker), and Patty Cake (Rafi Gavron) shrug off school to practice skateboarding, which they hope will be their ticket to a better life. But when they get mixed up in a drug deal and cross a ruthless crime queen-pin (Linda Emond), they put their friendship—and lives—on the line. Set to a hip-hop soundtrack and featuring an ensemble cast that includes Michael K. Williams, Erykah Badu and rapper Machine Gun Kelly

programme.title: Deja Vu
programme.desc: After a ferry is bombed in New Orleans, an ATF agent joins a unique investigation using experimental surveillance technology to find the bomber - but finds himself becoming obsessed with one of the victims. Denzel Washington stars

programme.title: My Community
programme.desc: Communities are the bedrock of society - physical spaces where residents share a collective purpose and common goals. But the internet has given rise to a new kind of community where lies and hate can flourish. In this episode meet a would-be utopia in Spain where civic life is managed on Twitter; a teacher who becomes the target of a digital lynch mob; and the father of a school shooting victim who must prove to the internet that his son existed(n)

programme.title: Criminal Justice
programme.desc: Is America's criminal justice system weighed down with bad science, ineffective methods, incompetence and corruption? Penn & Teller set out to reveal that the only thing scarier than crime is America's war on crime(n)
